result.execSummary:
The defendant Herbert Allen Tree III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DOC COLLECT.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Full Huber.
May leave Wisconsin for work.
3-25-19:  Court approves 14 hour days for work.
3-19-19:  Court approves defendant may attend AA meetings as needed.

supervisions.notes: Count 1 HELD OPEN - if defendant successfully completes all conditions of agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss Count 1 only.

miscConds.notes: $543.00 due 11-12-2015 DIRECTLY to Clerk of Court.

Stayed-Defendant to call Jail Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 3 business days or by 9-13-2015 for report date w/in 75 days or by 11-6-2015  Failure to do so within the specified time will result in the immediate issuance of a commitment to Jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
HUBER for AA, Psych Treatment, therapy, child care and work at Chrysler in Belvedere IL for 14 hours per day not including travel time.
May have non-violent contact with victim R.T. as authorized by DOC agent.

Must complete DVIP program.
Any other assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary.
